since_last_update: Policy-risk premium swung meaningfully: Trump headline flow around Greenland/NATO plus the explicit statement that Feb 1 tariffs would not be imposed (as reported broadly in real-time coverage) shifted the tape from headline-risk to relief-risk; this likely compressed near-term trade/geopolitical tail hedges vs prior baseline (Guardian).

Fed independence tail risk partially capped: Supreme Court appeared wary of Trump’s bid to fire Fed Governor Lisa Cook, reducing immediate odds of a governance shock even if the broader politicization theme remains (Bloomberg via Yahoo Finance).

US labor remains resilient at the margin: initial claims under consensus reinforces “no urgency to ease” framing into today’s inflation-sensitive window, keeping rate-vol as the main cross-asset transmission to NQ/ES (NEW local claims headline).
today_focus: Dominant driver check (today/session): policy-risk relief vs rates repricing. Relief impulse from tariff walkback/Greenland de-escalation is risk-supportive, but claims resilience keeps the market sensitive to real-rate moves and any inflation stickiness in the data run-up (Guardian; NEW local claims headline).

Gold focus: gold remains supported by macro/policy uncertainty + demand narratives (banks upgrading forecasts), but near-term direction is still most sensitive to USD/real-rate swings around US data and any reversal of geopolitical/trade tension headlines (MarketWatch; Business Insider; Guardian).

Rates-first routing for NQ vs ES: if yields/real rates back up on “sticky inflation + resilient labor,” NQ should remain the higher-beta expression (discount-rate sensitivity) even if headline policy risk fades; if yields ease, relief can broaden (inference anchored by claims + macro setup).

Headline/judicial micro-catalyst: any follow-through headlines on Fed governance (Cook case) or Fed-chair speculation can reprice term premia/vol without needing hard macro data (Bloomberg via Yahoo Finance).

market_pricing.dominant_driver: policy-risk relief competing with rates repricing (claims/real-rate sensitivity); driver is mixed but this is the highest-probability routing for ES/NQ and gold today

rates.what_market_seems_to_price: near-term Fed hold remains baseline; incremental data sensitivity concentrated in real rates and volatility rather than outright policy-path shift
rates.underpriced_risk: governance/political shock to Fed credibility or term premium (legal/political developments) causing non-linear moves in rates and equity duration

equities.what_market_seems_to_price: reduced near-term tariff shock probability supports risk assets, but positioning likely still cautious given ongoing political headlines and major inflation data risk
equities.underpriced_risk: regime where equities fail to rally on de-risking headlines because rates move the wrong way (higher real rates / tighter financial conditions)

gold.what_market_seems_to_price: structural demand + policy/geopolitical uncertainty premium remains embedded; gold narrative reinforced by bank forecast upgrades
gold.underpriced_risk: sharp drawdown risk on fast de-escalation + real-rate backup (or USD squeeze), versus extension risk if policy risk re-intensifies

risk_register.risk: Core PCE (and any inflation-adjacent components) triggers a real-rate shock that dominates any headline relief; NQ duration sensitivity highest
Policy headline gap risk persists despite tariff walkback: Greenland/NATO/framing could re-escalate, re-widening risk premia and lifting gold
Fed independence/governance tail: Cook case developments or Fed-chair nomination chatter reprice term premium and rates vol abruptly
Cross-asset adverse mix: equities weaken while yields rise (or gold up with yields up), indicating tighter financial conditions + hedging demand simultaneously

event_warnings: US Final GDP and GDP Price Index (Jan 22): typically lower incremental impact than advance, but can matter if price index/deflator reinforces “sticky inflation” framing (NEW local calendar).
Core PCE (Jan 22): primary macro catalyst for rates and gold; equity reaction likely routed through real-rate move (NEW local calendar).
Flash PMIs (Jan 23): can flip growth-vs-inflation balance quickly; watch prices-paid components for rate sensitivity (NEW local calendar).
Ongoing: any Supreme Court / legal headlines tied to Fed governance can hit rates volatility even without macro releases (Bloomberg via Yahoo Finance).
